column4: hrm, does ubuntu come with a standard GUI-based task killer at this point? or is there one out there that people here tend to like?
i can get around np on the CLI (for 'top' and 'killall'/'kill -9') but from an end user perspective it'd be nice to have... i've got one convert friend who likes ubuntu but hates CLI
you can stop processes using the system monitor
it is rather similar to windows task manager
